channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: German poison probe after drinks spiked at university in Darmstadt
item.description: Six people were taken to hospital with bluish extremities after using a science department's tea area.

item.title: Biscarosse beach: Man missing after French plane makes emergency landing
item.description: Rescue services search for a co-pilot who leapt into the sea when a light aircraft got into trouble.

item.title: Could this solar farm be a climate change solution?
item.description: UN experts say rapid innovative solutions are needed to end our dependency on fossil fuels. Could this new project provide an answer?

item.title: Tralee: Swimmer rescued after nearly 12 hours at sea
item.description: The man, believed to be from Londonderry, was spotted floating with a pod of dolphins miles from shore.

item.title: Russian toddler lost in woods for four days vows 'never again'
item.description: The 22-month-old Russian girl was found alive by a search party, four days after she wandered off.

item.title: Airbnb offers free accommodation for 20,000 Afghan refugees
item.description: Airbnb says it will house 20,000 Afghan refugees at no charge to help them resettle across the world.

item.title: Kylian Mbappe: Real Madrid bid £137m for Paris St-Germain forward
item.description: Real Madrid make a £137m bid to sign Paris St-Germain forward Kylian Mbappe.

item.title: Migrant crossings: What happens to migrants who reach the UK?
item.description: The government wants to cut the number of migrants crossing the Channel.

item.title: Mar Menor: Tonnes of dead fish wash up on Spanish lagoon's shores
item.description: Ecologists say pollution is to blame, as officials consider declaring the Mar Menor a disaster area.

item.title: Afghan crisis: Russia plans for new era with Taliban rule
item.description: While Western governments raced to get their people out, Russia appears unfazed by the takeover.

item.title: Wildfires: Provence wine producers assess impact of destruction
item.description: There are fears the fires that have hit rosé vineyards in Provence will push up prices.

item.title: Venezia FC: The club built on water rising to the top of Italian football
item.description: The stunning Italian city of Venice is not normally associated with its football club, but that could be set to change as a 19-year wait for a return to Serie A comes to an end.

item.title: Teenage pilot Zara Rutherford begins solo round-world record bid
item.description: Zara Rutherford completes the first leg of her journey from Belgium to England.

item.title: Afghan para-athlete Nilofar Bayat welcomed by new team in Spain
item.description: Nilofar Bayat, Afghan wheelchair basketball women's captain, is in Bilbao after fleeing the Taliban.

item.title: Wildfires rage across Europe
item.description: A look at some of the fires spreading across Europe - and the rest of the globe.

item.title: Afghan reporter asks Nato secretary general for help
item.description: Lailuma Sadid, a journalist with Brussels Morning Newspaper, became emotional when asking the Nato secretary general about the Taliban in Afghanistan.

item.title: BBC presenter flees French fires
item.description: "It was very, very, very frightening," says Geeta Guru-Murthy.

item.title: The shopkeeper saving his island from wildfires
item.description: Spyros isn't a firefighter, but when his home was threatened with wildfires, he decided to take action.
